00043 void define_aptcelextract_options(PgOptions* opts)
00044 {
00045   opts->setUsage("apt-cel-extract - Extract probe level intensities from cel files.\n"
00046                  "Usage:\n"
00047                  "   apt-cel-extract -o intensities.txt \\\n"
00048                  "       [-c chip.clf -p chip.pgf] || [-d chip.cdf] \\\n"
00049                  "       [--probeset-ids norm-exon.txt] \\\n"
00050                  "       [--probe-ids probelist.txt] \\\n"
00051                  "       [--analysis analysis-string [--target-sketch-file sketchfile.txt]] \\\n"
00052                  "       [--pm-only] | [--pm-with-mm-only] \\\n"
00053                  "       [--report-background] \\\n"
00054                  "       [--cel-files celfiles.txt] | [ file1.CEL ... ] \n"
00055                  "\n"
00056                  "Synopsis:\n" 
00057                  "\n"
00058                  "   Simple extraction with no library files: \n"
00059                  "       apt-cel-extract -o intensities.txt *.CEL\n"
00060                                  "  If the output file name includes the text \"SaturationReport\"\n"
00061                                  "  then instead of dumping all the cel intensities, a cel saturation report is written.\n"
00062                  "\n"
00063                  "   Simple extraction of myprobes.txt from WT-based expression array: \n"
00064                  "       apt-cel-extract -o intensities.txt -c chip.clf \\\n"
00065                  "           -p chip.pgf --probeset-ids myprobes.txt *.CEL\n"
00066                  "\n"
00067                  "   Simple extraction from CDF-based expression array: \n"
00068                  "       apt-cel-extract -o intensities.txt -d chip.cdf *.CEL\\\n"
00069                  "\n"
00070                  "   Extract quantile(sketch) normalized PM with GCBG values: \n"
00071                  "       apt-cel-extract -o intensities.txt -c chip.clf \\\n"
00072                  "           -p chip.pgf -b chip.bgp -a quant-norm,pm-gcbg \\\n"
00073                  "           --report-background --cel-files celfiles.txt \n"
00074                  "\n");
00075 
00076   opts->defOptMult("", "probeset-ids", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00077                    "File containing probeset ids to extract probe level data for. "
00078                    "If no probeset-ids and no probe-ids file is provided, "
00079                    "information will be extracted for all probes. "
00080                    "May be specified multiple times.",
00081                    "");
00082   opts->defOptMult("", "probe-ids", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00083                    "File containing probe ids to extract probe level data for. "
00084                    "May be specified multiple times.",
00085                    "");
00086   opts->defineOption("c", "clf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00087                      "The cel layout file, describing where a probe is within the cel file.",
00088                      "");
00089   opts->defineOption("p", "pgf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00090                      "The probe group file, describing what probes are included in what probe sets.",
00091                      "");
00092   opts->defineOption("d", "cdf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00093                      "Alternate method for describing probe sets. "
00094                      "Either -d or both -c and -p is required.",
00095                      "");
00096   opts->defineOption("s", "spf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00097                      "Use simple probe file (SPF) for chip layout."
00098                      "[Experimental]",
00099                      "");
00100   opts->defineOption("b", "bgp-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00101                      "The background probes file, describing what probes are to be used for "
00102                      "gc background adjustment. Required if --pm-gcbg extraction is requested.",
00103                      "");
00104   opts->defineOption("", "cel-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00105                      "Optional file containing the names of cel files to extract data from.",
00106                      "");
00107   opts->defineOption("o", "out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00108                      "Output file to contain the extraction output. If not provided, "
00109                      "the output will go to stdout (the console).",
00110                      "");
00111   opts->defineOption("","output-precision", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00112                      "Number of decimal places in output.",
00113                      "2");
00114   opts->defineOption("", "target-sketch-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00115                      "A target sketch to normalize to when using quant-norm.",
00116                      "");
00117   opts->defineOption("a", "analysis", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00118                      "An analysis string (no quant method) to use to transform intensities. "
00119                      "[EXPERIMENTAL]",
00120                      "");
00121   opts->defineOption("", "log-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00122                      "The name of the log file to generate.",
00123                      "");
00124   opts->defineOption("f", "force", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00125                      "Override sanity checks, for instance, requiring the same "
00126                      "lib file set/version in pgf, clf, and bgp files.",
00127                      "false");
00128   opts->defineOption("", "pm-only", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00129                      "Only report PM probes. Requires chip layout information.",
00130                      "false");
00131   opts->defineOption("", "pm-with-mm-only", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00132                      "Only report PM probes with have an MM. "
00133                      "Note only the PM probes are reported. "
00134                      "Requires chip layout information.",
00135                      "false");
00136   opts->defineOption("", "report-background", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00137                      "Report the background value associated with each probe. "
00138                      "Requires an analysis string and chip layout information. "
00139                      "[EXPERIMENTAL]",
00140                      "false");
00141   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00142                      "Display version information.",
00143                      "false");
00144   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00145                      "Print help message.",
00146                      "false");
00147   opts->defineOption("v", "verbose", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00148                      "How verbose to be with status messages 0 - quiet, 1 - usual messages, 2 - more messages.",
00149                      "1");
00150   opts->defineOption("","temp-dir", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00151                      "Directory for temporary files when working off disk. Using network mounted drives is not advised. When not set, the output folder will be used.",
00152                      "");
00153   opts->defineOption("", "use-disk", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00154                      "Store CEL intensities to be analyzed on disk.", "true");
00155   opts->defineOption("", "disk-cache", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00156                      "Size of intensity memory cache in millions of intensities (when --use-disk=true).",
00157                      "50");
00158 
00159 }

00161 /** Fill in options given command line args **/
00162 void fillInOptions(PgOptions *opts, CelExtractOptions &o, int argc) {
00163   //uint64_t free = 0, total = 0, swap = 0, avail = 0;
00164     o.version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00165     o.cvsId = AptVersionInfo::cvsId();
00166     o.progName = opts->getProgName();
00167     o.progName = Fs::basename(o.progName);
00168     o.execGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00169     o.timeStr = Util::getTimeStamp();
00170     if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00171         o.help = "true";
00172         return;
00173     }
00174     else
00175         o.help = "";
00176 
00177     if(opts->getBool("version")) {
00178         Verbose::out(0, "version: " + o.version);
00179         exit(0);
00180     }
00181     o.force = opts->getBool("force");
00182     o.verbosity = opts->getInt("verbose");
00183     o.diskDir = opts->get("temp-dir");
00184     o.useDisk = opts->getBool("use-disk");
00185     o.diskCache = opts->getInt("disk-cache");
00186     o.cdfFile = opts->get("cdf-file");
00187     o.pgfFile = opts->get("pgf-file");
00188     o.clfFile = opts->get("clf-file");
00189     o.spfFile = opts->get("spf-file");
00190     o.bgpFile = opts->get("bgp-file");
00191     //
00192     opts->mustFindOpt("probeset-ids")->push_user_values_into(o.probesetIdsFiles);
00193     opts->mustFindOpt("probe-ids")->push_user_values_into(o.probeIdsFiles);
00194     //
00195     o.outFile = opts->get("out-file");
00196     o.analysisString = opts->get("analysis");
00197     o.sketchInFile = opts->get("target-sketch-file");
00198 
00199     o.m_output_precision=opts->getInt("output-precision");
00200 
00201     o.pmOnly = opts->getBool("pm-only");
00202     o.ignoreProbesWithoutMM = opts->getBool("pm-with-mm-only");
00203     o.pairWithBackground = opts->getBool("report-background");
00204 
00205     /* Read in cel file list from other file if specified. */
00206     ///@todo this should go into Engine::Util as it is used in a number of apps
00207     if(opts->get("cel-files")!="") {
00208         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00209 #ifdef WIN32
00210         tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00211 #endif
00212         std::string celFiles = opts->get("cel-files");
00213         string file;
00214         tsv.bind(0, "cel_files", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00215         if(tsv.open(celFiles) != TSV_OK) {
00216             Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cel-files file: " + celFiles);
00217         }
00218         tsv.rewind();
00219         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00220             o.celFiles.push_back(Util::cloneString(file.c_str()));
00221         }
00222         tsv.close();
00223         Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(o.celFiles.size()) + " cel filenames from: " + Fs::basename(celFiles));
00224     }
00225     else {
00226         for(int i = 0; i < opts->getArgCount(); i++)
00227             o.celFiles.push_back(opts->getArg(i));
00228     }
00229 }
00230 
00231 /**
00232  * Report out some basics about what we think the run is:
00233  *
00234  * @param o - Program options.
00235  */
00236 void reportBasics(CelExtractOptions &o) {
00237     Verbose::out(3, "version=" + o.version);
00238     Verbose::out(3, "command-line=" + o.commandLine);
00239     Verbose::out(3, "exec-guid=" + o.execGuid);
00240     Verbose::out(3, "time=" + o.timeStr);
00241 #ifndef WIN32
00242     char name[8192];
00243     if(gethostname(name, ArraySize(name)) == 0)
00244         Verbose::out(3, "host=" + ToStr(name));
00245     else
00246         Verbose::out(3, "host=unknown");
00247     if(getcwd(name, ArraySize(name)) != NULL)
00248         Verbose::out(3, "cwd=" + ToStr(name));
00249     else
00250         Verbose::out(3, "cwd=unknown");
00251 #endif /* WIN32 */
00252 }
00253 
00254 /// @brief     The entry point for apt-cel-extract
00255 /// @param     argc      arg count
00256 /// @param     argv      arg strings
00257 /// @return    
00258 int main (int argc, char* argv[])
00259 {
00260   try {
00261     PgOptions *opts = NULL;
00262 
00263     ofstream logOut;
00264 
00265     /* Parse options. */
00266     opts = new PgOptions();
00267     define_aptcelextract_options(opts);
00268     opts->parseArgv(argv);
00269     fillInOptions(opts, ourOpts, argc);
00270     Verbose::setLevel(ourOpts.verbosity);
00271 
00272     /* Print our help message if necessary. */
00273     if(ourOpts.help == "true" || argc == 1) {
00274         map<string,string>::iterator iter;
00275         opts->usage();
00276         cout << endl << "version: " << ourOpts.version << endl;
00277         exit(0);
00278     }
00279     /* Off we go to work. */
00280     else {
00281         time_t startTime = time(NULL);
00282 
00283         LogStream log;
00284         if(opts->get("log-file")!="") {
00285             string logName = opts->get("log-file");
00286             Fs::mustOpenToWrite(logOut, logName.c_str());
00287             log.setStream(&logOut);
00288             Verbose::pushMsgHandler(&log);
00289             Verbose::pushProgressHandler(&log);
00290             Verbose::pushWarnHandler(&log);
00291         }
00292 
00293   // Run the engine. Will exit with non-zero exit statis if fails.
00294         reportBasics(ourOpts);
00295 
00296         /* Do the work */
00297         CelExtract ce(ourOpts);
00298         ce.extract();
00299 
00300         /* Hmm, precision doesn't seem to work on cout, get 2 decimal places the hard way. */
00301         time_t endTime = time(NULL);
00302         int t = int(  (float)(endTime - startTime) / 60.0 * 100); // convert to minutes
00303         Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Run took approximately: ") + ToStr((float)t/100) + ToStr(" minutes."));
00304 
00305         if(opts->get("log-file")!="") {
00306             logOut.close();
00307         }
00308     }
00309     delete opts;
00310     return 0;
00311   } 
00312   catch(...) {
00313       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00314       return 1;
00315   }
00316   return 1;
00317 }
